subject: Parenting
title: The Bobo Doll Experiment
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Bobo Doll Experiment usable.

hook.text: Albert Bandura showed children a video of an adult hitting a doll. Then he gave them the same doll.

buildup.text: The 1961 experiment tested whether aggression could be learned simply by observation.

discovery.text: Children who watched the aggressive model were far more aggressive â€” they copied specific actions exactly.

twist.text: They also invented new aggressive behaviors the model hadn't shown â€” aggression generalized.

climax.text: This study reshaped understanding of how behavior spreads â€” children absorb and extend what they see.

punchline.text: Children learn violence the same way they learn everything: by watching.

quiz.question: What surprising thing did children do after watching the aggressive model?
options: They also invented new aggressive behaviors not shown
They refused to play with the doll
They showed no change in behavior
